DataElement.preferredName: Second Line Bevacizumab Chemotherapy Occurrence Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether second line therapy with Bevacizumab was administered to a patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The second preferred therapy for a particular condition, used after first-line treatment fails or if a person cannot tolerate first-line drugs._A monoclonal antibody that may prevent the growth of blood vessels from surrounding tissue to a solid tumor._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition:
The second preferred therapy for a particular condition, used after first-line treatment fails or if a person cannot tolerate first-line drugs.
:A monoclonal antibody that may prevent the growth of blood vessels from surrounding tissue to a solid tumor.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term may be used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is most commonly used to refer to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer.  Cancer chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells.  Because cancer cells usually divide much faster than normal cells, they are often very sensitive to the inhibitory actions of chemotherapeutic agents.  Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity. (NCI04)

Concepts.definition: The second preferred therapy for a particular condition, used after first-line treatment fails or if a person cannot tolerate first-line drugs.

A recombinant humanized monoclonal antibody directed against the vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF), a pro-angiogenic cytokine.  Bevacizumab binds to VEGF and inhibits VEGF receptor binding, thereby preventing the growth and maintenance of tumor blood vessels.
The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
